ygData.subject: RE: More info on working with Darkwood
ygData.msgSnippet: From: Bonecrkr  snip---  I was discussing making various bows with a skill of 170 ... failure ... are ... darkwoods ... What I meant
ygData.messageBody:
From: "Bonecrkr" <bonecrkr@...>

snip---> I was discussing making various bows with a skill of 170

>> Yes it is safe to work with Oak. You are not likely to cry from a
failure
>> on Darkwood, when you can easily pick up 350pp from your bank account and
>> click destroy.

>Could you expound on this a little? I have discovered that all Oak bows
are
>trivial to me (although I haven't made the 2 cam variety yet). Is a skill
>of 170 sufficient to start making Darkwood bows? At what point do
darkwoods
>become trivial if at ever? What's the failure rate at 170 vs close to 200.

What I meant was, if you cannot afford to lose the plat to make it, you will
most likely cry from a failure. I have a few thousand plat in the bank, so
failing one is not that big a financial setback.

> >> What is a good price to charge for the Oak and Ashwood bows or even the
>> trueshot if I get my lazy butt up to do the quest.
>>
>> Ash I sell for 25pp (No tool versions)
>>
>> Oak I sell for 150 to 175 depending on the tools, and I don't sell Cammed
>> Oak bows (if I did they would be 250). Trueshot I sell for 300pp, I will
>> sell it for 200pp if they give me a staff and I don't fail it. I
>> only sell
>> 2 Darkwoods, both with Planing Tool and Silk, the 1-Cam for 600pp and the
>> 2-Cam for 750pp.. I have heard, but not tested, that you cannot
>> double cam
>> Oak.

>I've been thinking along the same way. I have sold 4 basic Oak bows
(hemp),
>each for 150pp and one 1 cam made with planing tool and silk for 200pp
>(should I charge more do you think)? Is double cam broken for some reason?
>What have you heard? How much would you sell a basic Darkwood bow for (no
>planing or cams)?

I don't think that the Oak 2-Cam is "broken" at all. I just don't think
that you can make a Compound (2 Cam) Oak bow.

Here are the bows I sell

Ash, Hemp, 16/100/58 for 25pp
Ash, Linen, 15/100/54 for 25pp
Ash, Silk, 14/100/50 for 25pp
Oak, Silk, Planing Tool, 17/125/48 for 150pp to 175pp depending on my mood
(I have never sold any other oak)
Darkwood, 1-Cam, Planing Tool, Silk, 20/150/46 for 600pp
Darkwood, 2-Cam, Planing Tool, Silk, 19/150/41 for 700 to 750pp
